chapter.title: Payment Options
chapter.para: onCourse makes online sales simple with a range of payment options for enrolling students. With a complete shopping cart students can enrol in multiple classes in a single transaction, enrol a friend or with your approval send the invoice to their employer.

onCourse eCommerce doesn't handle only enrolments; it also includes product, memberships and gift voucher sales allowing you to diversify your business and the way people can buy and share your products.

section.title: Credit card
section.para: Real-time credit card processing ensures that successful enrolments are only made when the money is in your account.

caption.para: Using a credit card when paying for an enrolment

section.title: Corporate Pass
section.para: CorporatePass gives approved users the ability to invoice their employer on enrolment. That way you can develop a close relationship with your corporate customers, but still allow their staff to select training timetables to suit themselves.

You can view, edit, create or disable a Corporate Pass within onCourse by clicking on the CorporatePass button that can be found in the marketing tab. Once you have clicked on the CorporatePass button a window will pop up with a list of current and expired (if you check the filter in the left column) Corporate Passes created. You can view an existing corportate pass by double clicking on a record, or alternatively create one by click on the '+' symbol in the top right hand of the window. More information on Corporate Passes can be found in the CorporatePass chapter of the handbook.

caption.para: Using a CorporatePass code to complete an online enrolment without the need of any payment at that time

section.title: Vouchers and Gift Certificates
section.para: Vouchers are much more than a simple gift voucher. They can be used to sell training in flexible groups whether it be a sampler of arts courses or OH&S training for 20 co-workers. More information on Vouchers of Gift Certificates can be found in the Vouchers chapter of the handbook.

section.title: Concessions/Memberships
section.para: With onCourse memberships for individuals or employers, you can offer special prices to your select members or create a gym membership style training programme. Memberships can be sold or give away, and expire whenever you choose. You can add a concession or membership in th summary section whilst enrolling online. A '+' symbol with text 'Add Concession' can be found below you name and email address.

section.title: Credit
section.para: If a student has credit when enrolling they will have an option to use it on the 'PAYMENT' page during the online enrolment process. There will be text saying 'Credit available' above the payment summary and to use their credit thet have to click on the text 'Access'.

caption.para: What the student you will see if they have credit

section.para: Once they have clicked on the text 'Access' a box will appear along them to enter their password (this would be the same password they use to log into skillsonCourse). If they can't remember it then they can click the 'Forgot password' link that will take them to their skillsonCourse log in page where inturn they can recover their password.

After they have summited their password a new line of text will appear where the text 'Credit available' was. As in the case below the student had $200 of credit and the cost of the class was only $175, so they have nothing to pay today along with an additonal $25 of credit left over.
